head.citation-title: International Workshop on Neural Networks, WIRN 2015
head.abstracts: The proceedings contain 52 papers. The special focus in this conference is on Machine Learning, Artificial Neural Networks and Neural Networks-Based Approaches to Industrial Processes. The topics include: Semi-automatic brain lesion segmentation in gamma knife treatments using an unsupervised fuzzy c-means clustering technique; machine learning based data mining for milky way filamentary structures reconstruction; frequency-domain adaptive filtering in hypercomplex systems; Bayesian clustering on images with factor graphs in reduced normal form; selection of negative examples for node label prediction through fuzzy clustering techniques; recent advances on distributed unsupervised learning; model complexity control in clustering; benchmarking functional link expansions for audio classification tasks; a comparison of consensus strategies for distributed learning of random vector functional-link networks; a Bayesian-based neural network model for solar photovoltaic power forecasting; strict pyramidal deep architectures for person re-identification; a pilot study on the decoding of dynamic emotional expressions in major depressive disorder; improving functional link neural network learning scheme for mammographic classification; quantifying the complexity of epileptic EEG; a new ICT based model for wellness and health care; analyzing correlations between personality disorders and frontal functions; processing bio-medical data with class-dependent feature selection; LQR based training of adaptive neuro-fuzzy controller; structured versus shuffled connectivity in cortical dynamics; machine learning techniques for the estimation of particle size distribution in industrial plants; combining multiple neural networks to predict bronze alloy elemental composition and non linear time series analysis of air pollutants with missing data.

confevent.confname: International Workshop on Neural Networks, WIRN 2015

confsponsor.$: Comune di Vietri sul Mare, Salerno (Italy)
Department of Psychology, Second University of Napoli (Italy)
International Institute for Advanced Scientific Studies (IIASS) of Vietri S/M (Italy)

source.issuetitle: Advances in Neural Networks - Computational Intelligence for ICT

publisher.publishername: Springer Science and Business Media Deutschland GmbH
